course.subject: MATH
course.name: Algebraic Topology
course.description: Fundamental group, covering space, Van Kampen theorem, (relative) homology, exact sequences of homology, Mayer-Vietoris sequence, excision theorem, Betti numbers and Euler characteristic.

reviews.author: JWe
reviews.comment_content: The course basically follows Hatcher's book. As a preliminary, it is good to know some category theory. The approach of the course is quite different from Hatcher's style. It is closer to May's style. For example, the proof of Van Kampen theorem utilized fundamental groupoid instead of the geometric proof given by Hatcher. It is also important to be familiar with modules. It would be good to know tensor product, Hom, limit, colimit, etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: The path is quick, but proof is clear and clean.
reviews.comment_grading: Nice grade. NO HW. Take home final.
